current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To advance the purposes of the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail Interpretive Center, and for
			 other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail Interpretive Center Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail Interpretive Center Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The purposes of this Act are—

to provide for a pilot program of public-private partnership regarding the operation of the Lewis
			 and Clark National Historic Trail Interpretive Center;
to promote the use and development of the Interpretive Center by the Lewis & Clark Foundation, in support of the purposes of

to allow and promote use of the Interpretive Center, with the goal of achieving financial
			 self-sustainability; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to participate and cooperate in the operation of the
			 Interpretive Center as necessary or desirable to promote—

text.#text: to authorize the
the conservation and management of United States public land;
the use, understanding, and enjoyment of—
the Interpretive Center; and
natural resources and natural history; and
interpretation of the historical events associated with—
the Lewis				and Clark Expedition;
Native Americans; and
the American West.
In this Act:

term.#tail:
means the Lewis & Clark Foundation, a nonprofit corporation existing under the laws of the State (or any successor
			 in interest to that foundation).

header.#text: Reservation of rights in United States

text.#text:
At all times, the United States shall reserve the right to locate, develop, and use the
			 Interpretive Center for other uses by the Federal Government that are
			 compatible with the purposes and operation of Interpretive Center.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail Interpretive Center Act of 2014/s:6/ss:d/p:1

text.#text: The Foundation shall be consulted prior to any development or use under

The Foundation shall maintain general liability insurance for the duration of the lease under this
			 section, in such  amount as is agreed to by the
The United States shall be named as an additional insured under the policy.
The lease under this Act—

shall permit the Foundation to assume stewardship responsibilities for the Interpretive Center,
			 including through—
the sale of souvenirs and merchandise;
the provision of food and visitor services;
the rental of facilities for short-term events; and
the assessment of admission and use fees in an amount determined by the Foundation; and
may permit the Foundation, with prior written approval of the
to construct or renovate any applicable improvements; and

to sublet any space or facility  for any use that is compatible with the purposes of the
			 Interpretive Center.

The Foundation shall have sole discretion to establish and charge admission and use fees for the
			 Interpretive Center.

The Foundation may retain and use all amounts generated from the operation of the Interpretive
			 Center, including through—
the sale of merchandise; and
the assessment of admission and use fees.
The Foundation shall maintain documents and accounts that are—
prepared by an accountant certified or licensed by a State regulatory authority; and
prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
All documents and accounts of the Foundation shall be open to inspection by—
the
other appropriate Federal officials.

The Interpretive Center shall be considered to be Federal property for purposes of taxation by the
			 State government and units of local government.

Nothing in this Act exempts the Foundation or the Interpretive Center from the collection and
			 payment of any sales or excise tax.
